summary: This document is a series of official inmate count sheets and assignment rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 9, 2019. It records the census of inmates in various housing units and lists specific inmate assignments, including one inmate assigned to suicide watch. The documents are administrative records from the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.

persons.name: Davila

events.title: Daily Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: Administrative headcount of inmates across various housing units (B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, Z-B) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Inmate Assignment to Suicide Watch
events.description: An inmate with the last name Santana (REG # 48816-066) is listed with an assignment category of 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' on the operational roster.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
An inmate named Santana (REG # 48816-066) is listed with an assignment category of 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' (Suicide Watch or Unassigned) on that date.
The records show a detailed official inmate count across multiple housing units, part of the facility's standard administrative procedure.
The documents are purely administrative prison forms (count sheets, assignment rosters) and do not mention Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any other key figures in the case by name.
